/O.NEW.KLMK.SV.W.0095.140604T1949Z-140604T2010Z/

BULLETIN - IMMEDIATE BROADCAST REQUESTED
SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LOUISVILLE KY
349 PM EDT WED JUN 4 2014

THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN LOUISVILLE HAS ISSUED A

* SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR...
  SOUTHEASTERN CLARK COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL KENTUCKY...
  NORTHEASTERN MADISON COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL KENTUCKY...

* UNTIL 410 PM EDT

* AT 346 PM EDT...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WAS LOCATED 6 MILES SOUTH OF
  WINCHESTER...AND MOVING EAST AT 35 MPH.

  HAZARD...60 MPH WIND GUSTS.

  SOURCE...RADAR INDICATED.

  IMPACT...EXPECT DAMAGE TO ROOFS...SIDING AND TREES.

* LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE...
  COTTON BRANCH...RUCKERVILLE...AGAWAM...MINA...PILOT VIEW...TRAPP...
  VIANNA...HEDGES...LOG LICK...RIGHTANGLE...PINE RIDGE...THOMSON...
  RABBIT TOWN...GOFFS CORNER AND KIDDVILLE.

PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

REMAIN ALERT FOR A POSSIBLE TORNADO! TORNADOES CAN DEVELOP QUICKLY
FROM SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS. IF YOU SPOT A TORNADO GO AT ONCE INTO THE
BASEMENT OR SMALL CENTRAL ROOM IN A STURDY STRUCTURE.

FOR YOUR PROTECTION MOVE TO AN INTERIOR ROOM ON THE LOWEST FLOOR OF A
BUILDING.

&&

      3784 8405 3783 8408 3784 8409 3783 8410

TORNADO...POSSIBLE
HAIL...<.75IN
WIND...60MPH
